name: Katherine Jenkins
religion: Jenkins is a devout Christian, likely a member of the Church in Wales.
politicalViews: Jenkins prefers to keep her politics to herself, but refused Labour advances and seems to think there's just something about the Conservative's David Cameron.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: Katherine Jenkins was born and raised in Neath, Wales, United Kingdom.
Jenkins is a Christian. We're going to assume she is a member of the Church in Wales (even though she can be found cited as a member of the Anglican faith
) because she attended the Alderman Davies Church in Wales Primary School in Neath
and the Church in Wales is the largest Christian denomination in that country.
The topic of her faith seems to only come up when she speaks of her late father–who died of lung cancer when she was 15. Jenkins said that his passing was difficult for her. She said:

content.sourceTitle: Siren of our times – Katherine Jenkins interview
content.text: My faith has always been important to me, but after Dad died I turned my back on the church for a while.
But she came around eventually, and seems to have made peace with her father's death and her religious beliefs:

content.sourceTitle: Katherine Jenkins: Confessions of a choirgirl
content.text: [I believe] in heaven. I believe my dad is somewhere doing something nice.

content.sourceTitle: What's this? Katherine Jenkins is joining the Mormons?
content.text: She's not averse to canoodling with other faiths if it's for a high profile singing gig. She sang as a guest with the Mormon Tabernacle Choir in 2012, causing some who are not aware that the MTC often brings in guests to question if Jenkins was going Mormon–
probably just good exposure and a chance to sing with a top-notch choir.

content.sourceTitle: Katherine Jenkins refuses to sing for Gordon Brown
content.text: Jenkins doesn't appear to be too political. We can only make some conjectures based on a couple of interesting facts. First, she was asked by Britain's Labour Party to sing at their 2009 Party Conference–and refused.
When speculations arose that she was possibly Conservative or just anti-Labour, someone in the Jenkins camp released this statement:

content.sourceTitle: Katherine Jenkins refuses to sing for Gordon Brown
content.text: She keeps her politics to herself, and prefers to keep it to the voting booth.
Well, my argument? Look how gleeful she looks in this  with David Cameron. She's looking at him like he gently, but powerfully holds the fate of the world in his hands. You be the judge.
